trans-unit.source: Use Hadoop Hive with PowerShell in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Hadoop Hive with PowerShell in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use PowerShell to run Hive queries in Hadoop on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Use PowerShell to run Hive queries in Hadoop on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: This document provides an example of using Azure PowerShell to run Hive queries in a Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This document provides an example of using Azure PowerShell to run Hive queries in a Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: This document does not provide a detailed description of what the HiveQL statements that are used in the examples do.
trans-unit.target: This document does not provide a detailed description of what the HiveQL statements that are used in the examples do.

trans-unit.source: For information on the HiveQL that is used in this example, see <linkText>Use Hive with Hadoop on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information on the HiveQL that is used in this example, see <linkText>Use Hive with Hadoop on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following.
trans-unit.target: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following.

trans-unit.source: An Azure HDInsight (Hadoop on HDInsight) cluster (Windows-based or Linux-based)
trans-unit.target: An Azure HDInsight (Hadoop on HDInsight) cluster (Windows-based or Linux-based)

trans-unit.source: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell provides cmdlets that allow you to remotely run Hive queries on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell provides cmdlets that allow you to remotely run Hive queries on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Internally, this is accomplished by using REST calls to <linkText>WebHCat</linkText><title></title> (formerly called Templeton) running on the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Internally, this is accomplished by using REST calls to <linkText>WebHCat</linkText><title></title> (formerly called Templeton) running on the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The following cmdlets are used when running Hive queries in a remote HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: The following cmdlets are used when running Hive queries in a remote HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: Add-AzureAccount: Authenticates Azure PowerShell to your Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: Add-AzureAccount: Authenticates Azure PowerShell to your Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: New-AzureHDInsightHiveJobDefinition: Creates a new job definition by using the specified HiveQL statements
trans-unit.target: New-AzureHDInsightHiveJobDefinition: Creates a new job definition by using the specified HiveQL statements

trans-unit.source: Start-AzureHDInsightJob: Sends the job definition to HDInsight, starts the job, and returns a job object that can be used to check the status of the job
trans-unit.target: Start-AzureHDInsightJob: Sends the job definition to HDInsight, starts the job, and returns a job object that can be used to check the status of the job

trans-unit.source: Wait-AzureHDInsightJob: Uses the job object to check the status of the job.
trans-unit.target: Wait-AzureHDInsightJob: Uses the job object to check the status of the job.

trans-unit.source: It will wait until the job completes or the wait time is exceeded.
trans-unit.target: It will wait until the job completes or the wait time is exceeded.

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureHDInsightJobOutput: Used to retrieve the output of the job
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureHDInsightJobOutput: Used to retrieve the output of the job

trans-unit.source: Invoke-Hive: Used to run HiveQL statements.
trans-unit.target: Invoke-Hive: Used to run HiveQL statements.

trans-unit.source: This will block the query completes, then returns the results
trans-unit.target: This will block the query completes, then returns the results

trans-unit.source: Use-AzureHDInsightCluster: Sets the current cluster to use for the Invoke-Hive command
trans-unit.target: Use-AzureHDInsightCluster: Sets the current cluster to use for the Invoke-Hive command

trans-unit.source: The following steps demonstrate how to use these cmdlets to run a job in your HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: The following steps demonstrate how to use these cmdlets to run a job in your HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: Using an editor, save the following code as hivejob.ps1.
trans-unit.target: Using an editor, save the following code as hivejob.ps1.

trans-unit.source: You must replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: You must replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Open a new Azure PowerShell command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Open a new Azure PowerShell command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Change directories to the location of the hivejob.ps1 file, then use the following command to run the script:
trans-unit.target: Change directories to the location of the hivejob.ps1 file, then use the following command to run the script:

trans-unit.source: When the job completes, it should return information similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: When the job completes, it should return information similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: As mentioned earlier, Invoke-Hive can be used to run a query and wait for the response.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned earlier, Invoke-Hive can be used to run a query and wait for the response.

trans-unit.source: Use the following commands, and replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your cluster:
trans-unit.target: Use the following commands, and replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your cluster:

trans-unit.source: The output will look like the following:
trans-unit.target: The output will look like the following:

trans-unit.source: For longer HiveQL queries, you can use the Azure PowerShell Here-Strings cmdlet or HiveQL script files.
trans-unit.target: For longer HiveQL queries, you can use the Azure PowerShell Here-Strings cmdlet or HiveQL script files.

trans-unit.source: The following snippet shows how to use the Invoke-Hive cmdlet to run a HiveQL script file.
trans-unit.target: The following snippet shows how to use the Invoke-Hive cmdlet to run a HiveQL script file.

trans-unit.source: The HiveQL script file must be uploaded to wasb://.
trans-unit.target: The HiveQL script file must be uploaded to wasb://.

trans-unit.source: Invoke-Hive -File "wasb://@//query.hql"
trans-unit.target: Invoke-Hive -File "wasb://@//query.hql"

trans-unit.source: For more information about Here-Strings, see Using Windows PowerShell Here-Strings.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Here-Strings, see Using Windows PowerShell Here-Strings.

trans-unit.source: If no information is returned when the job completes, an error may have occurred during processing.
trans-unit.target: If no information is returned when the job completes, an error may have occurred during processing.

trans-unit.source: To view error information for this job, add the following to the end of the hivejob.ps1 file, save it, and then run it again.
trans-unit.target: To view error information for this job, add the following to the end of the hivejob.ps1 file, save it, and then run it again.

trans-unit.source: This returns the information that is written to STDERR on the server when you ran the job, and it may help determine why the job is failing.
trans-unit.target: This returns the information that is written to STDERR on the server when you ran the job, and it may help determine why the job is failing.

trans-unit.source: As you can see, Azure PowerShell provides an easy way to run Hive queries in an HDInsight cluster, monitor the job status, and retrieve the output.
trans-unit.target: As you can see, Azure PowerShell provides an easy way to run Hive queries in an HDInsight cluster, monitor the job status, and retrieve the output.
